description: Borrowed from Latin ēiaculātus, perfect passive participle of ēiaculor (“hurl, shoot out”), from ē (“out”) + iaculor (“throw, dart”), from iaculum (“a missile, a dart”), from iaciō (“to throw, to hurl”).

entries.meaning: Fluid or some other substance ejected or suddenly thrown from a duct or other body structure; specifically, semen or vaginal fluid ejected by a human being or other mammal during an ejaculation.

verbs.description: ejaculate (third-person singular simple present ejaculates, present participle ejaculating, simple past and past participle ejaculated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To eject abruptly; to throw out suddenly and swiftly.
(biology, transitive) To eject or suddenly throw fluid or some other substance from a duct or other body structure.
(specifically, transitive and intransitive) Of a human being or other mammal: to forcibly eject from the urethra in response to sexual stimulation, in a male, semen; and, in a female, vaginal fluid.
examples: Men can ejaculate between 0.1 and 10 milliliters of semen on average. (transitive)
With a groan, he ejaculated on his abdomen. (intransitive)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To sexually stimulate (someone) so that they eject fluid from the urethra.
